item.title: AICTE to HECI: Alphabet soup for India’s autonomy-starved technical institutions
item.description: Note: This article was originally published on The Ken website and is subject to their copyright terms and conditions. Summary Established in 1945 to improve the quality of technical education in India, AICTE’s authority has expanded, often at the expense of the autonomy of engineering colleges AICTE’s reach is so thorough that engineering colleges have been restricted in much of their operations from curriculum design to interdisciplinary research
